tweets.text: @EnvAgency Water is still gushing out over Hackney Marshes from the @thameswater main that burst on October 6th. üò¢ https://t.co/bnnGojjwpB

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

Our water supplies are under pressure from climate change, population growth and drought.

We've launched a consultation on our updated map of the areas where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard future water supplies. Share your views here: https://t.co/WBWHPEVE9u https://t.co/smkQXkHtCJ

tweets.text:
The @guardian‚Äôs take on our prosecution of @thameswater today... ‚¨áÔ∏è

... for polluting an #Oxfordshire stream... More than 1,100 fish died...

... including roach, perch and pike...

More evidence we ARE a tough regulator... 
#legalnews #environment https://t.co/HR5hXP1evW

Breaking: @thameswater fined ¬£2.3m, with costs of nearly ¬£90,000 for ‚Äúentirely foreseeable‚Äù #pollution.

More than 1,100 fish died when equipment failures released sewage into 2 streams at Henley in 2016.
Please report suspected pollution in rivers and streams to us: 0800 807060 https://t.co/cIwVfJmJ8q

More hard work from @EnvAgency to repair the embankment at #LuntMeadows üéâ Please don't visit the reserve while works are taking place as heavy plant machinery will be operating for the next few weeks. You can find out more here: https://t.co/R1NULAET8m https://t.co/gZigRCAGbU
Appears I might not be the only one that thinks there needs to be wholesale change at the @EnvAgency. https://t.co/HxjsbyCtIP
@StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk Look at this domestic air monitoring.  Residents, including myself, have raised this time and time again.  We need action now to protect our health. #stopthestink

#Oil spill in #Windsor. 20 #Swans #rescued with #oil. Thanks to @Dorney_Lake @Eton_College
for coming to the rescue with an emergency #oilspillkit which prevented a major incident. Thanks  to @Swan_Sanctuary. Also @EnvAgency & @thameswater for attending to this emergency. https://t.co/P9Kqst3JDM

tweets.text:
Today it truly felt like spring on the nature reserve. Our first toads üê∏ of the year, singing skylark and a beautiful sunny day ‚òÄÔ∏è #FeelGoodFriday #sanddunes #signsofspring 
@Lancswildlife @fyldecouncil @LivingSeasNW @EnvAgencyNW @BpoolCouncil https://t.co/ytasevlo8W

ENVIRONMENT AGENCY MONITORING STATION

The first @EnvAgencyMids monitoring station is now live. Councillors @SimonTagg and Stephen Sweeney walked the estate with me: there was quite a strong odour present, with momentary gusts of very strong odour.

https://t.co/9vl5xaQgzq https://t.co/l5ND433yaf
A favourable change in the weather and some serious shingle shifting on #Seaford beach #shingle #SeaDefences #SussexCoast #diggers #climate @EnvAgency https://t.co/AL7EU6uQ3v

It‚Äôs official, our new fishing licences will be released on March 1 2021 

Which species do you think will feature on the new licences?

Buy yours from 1 March at: https://t.co/gUzhQTY4NQ #FishingLicence #Angling https://t.co/zJg7vZ5cGB
@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids I read earlier they denied it was bad - shocking! Let‚Äôs hope this provides more ‚Äúevidence‚Äù As obviously 1000‚Äôs of fed up residents cannot be heard üôÑüò¨

Last week our Rivers Team @LYR_Shropshire helped to plant 8,000 trees near Clun, creating habitat, a #carbonstore & slowing the flow. These oaks replace conifers planted 50 years ago, despite the site being ancient woodland.
Funded by @EnvAgency, planted by Cashmore Contracting https://t.co/YfjkVxQoBI

Visit today with @ChurnetFarmers co-ordinators at a large, intensive dairy farm where -back in 2016- @ChurnetValley @StaffsWildlife & the farmer constructed reedbeds & ponds to manage surplus yard run off. 

Need loads more of this!

(funding: @EnvAgencyMids & @HeritageFundUK) https://t.co/lbely4R0jD

I guess many people accept this as the inevitable consequence of a water industry driven by profit for its' shareholders but I do not. This is truly shocking. Disgusting. And a scandal. Well done those volunteers. Shame on @thameswater @EnvAgency https://t.co/cDoJ7WrDZZ

@RobMungovan @HMWTBadger @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust I mostly dream of having that number of trees to play with...
Looks pretty tasty already in those shots.

tweets.text: @Plasmadreamer @EnvAgencyYNE @NEYorksNLincs @YorkshireWater The site is a floodplain, hence the standing water at the moment. The effluent jets through the access lids only when river levels are high. I'm guessing there's a flap valve to prevent river water backing up the discharge pipe.

The failure to properly address the cash/fines/fly tipping/dump mountain/fires/ dodgy export brigade for 10 years is killing the guys trying to do things correctly. The dodgy apples are rotting the whole barrel. @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd @JamesBevanEA @HMRCgovuk https://t.co/bJJK8kFOB1

tweets.text:
Fountains of sewage spurting from access chambers on Clifton Ings SSSI today. A regular occurrence when river levels are high, as has been pointed out many, many times to @EnvAgencyYNE, @NEYorksNLincs, @YorkshireWater. 
This is discharge pipe from Rawcliffe STW to River Ouse. https://t.co/2fWesgc9ow

@whiterosegreen @EnvAgencyYNE @NEYorksNLincs @YorkshireWater Also out of interest, is the river always this high or is the river in flood? Does the final effluent always discharge out of the covers in this manner?
